Asthma is controlled if :

o asthma symptoms are under control (assessed by questioning over the last 4 weeks using the ACT (asthma control test) questionnaire)

o exacerbations are rare: < 2 courses of systemic corticosteroid therapy in the previous year

o no bronchial obstruction: FEV1/FVC > 0.7 and FEV1 ≥ 80%.

question.title: What does asthma control indicate?
question.description: Asthma control is determined by what?

option_b.title: Exacerbations are frequent
option_b.description: Exacerbations occur at least once a month

option_d.title: Systemic corticosteroid therapy is used frequently
option_d.description: Systemic corticosteroid therapy is used at least once a month
